abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Tertiary Education
            Finance for Results Project for Chile were as follows:
            outcomes were satisfactory; the risk to development outcome
            was low or negligible; the Bank's performance was
            moderately satisfactory; and the Borrower's performance
            was highly satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            competent and stable leadership and team in the Project
            Implementation Unit (PIU) were a key component of project
            success. Rigorous results scoring in Academic Innovation
            Fund (FIAC) subprojects increased comparability and
            performance tracking. Realistic timelines for implementation
            require taking into account the borrower's cycle for
            budgetary approval in congress and the internal approval
            processes for the various legal documents needed throughout
            the life of the project. Execution of performance based
            funding requires experienced staff to mediate between the
            universities implementing the agreements and the Ministry of education.
